MAD-IIC-HERO.name: Marauder IIC Hero Structure

MAD-IIC-SC.name: Scorch
MAD-IIC-SC.description: Unique set of quirks for the Marauder IIC Scorch Hero 'Mech

RUGGED1.name: Rugged (1)
RUGGED1.description: This 'Mech does not require much attention to keep it active and ready.

RUGGED2.name: Rugged (2)
RUGGED2.description: This 'Mech does not require much attention to keep it active and ready.

TRIALMECH.name: On Loan
TRIALMECH.description: This 'Mech was offered to your modest little startup of a Mercenary Company under a rather fantastic deal. What they didn't tell you however, is that you're going to be paying through the nose until you can get a 'Mech to replace it with.

CLANOMNI.name: Clan OmniMech
CLANOMNI.description: The way the Clans fought was well reflected in the designs of their Battlemechs, often being shown by how quick and maneuverable they were.

CLAN.name: Clan BattleMech
CLAN.description: The way the Clans fought was well reflected in the designs of their Battlemechs, often being shown by how quick and maneuverable they were.

ISOMNI.name: IS OmniMech
ISOMNI.description: An Inner Sphere OmniMech, able to switch components around in no time at all, something the great houses learned to harness from the invading Clans.

IS.name: IS BattleMech
IS.description: An Inner Sphere BattleMech, a tried and true design that lasted for centuries, and will last for millenia.

PIRATE.name: Pirate BattleMech
PIRATE.description: Designed in the deepest parts of the Periphery with god knows what facilities they could muster, it is a Battlemech that truly no nation but a pirate nation, would ever be proud of calling it their own.

PIRATEFRANKEN.name: Pirate FrankenMech
PIRATEFRANKEN.description: Built out of parts from multiple different 'Mechs, it can almost be considered a new one in its own right and worthy of having a name to make it known - But a FrankenMech is not without its issues.

HERO.name: Hero 'Mech
HERO.description: This 'Mech was once piloted by a notable figure in the universe. What happened to them, is not clear, but what is clear is that their 'Mech is now yours to keep.

ROYAL.name: Star League Royal
ROYAL.description: Designed to fit the needs of the Star League Defense Force's Royal Divisions, it serves as a demonstration of the technological advancements made during that era.

CLANBUSTER.name: Clanbuster
CLANBUSTER.description: A ComStar designed refit for the Battle of Tukayyid, featuring the latest tech to withstand against the Clans.

OMNIMECH.name: OmniMech
OMNIMECH.description: An Omnimech, able to switch components around in no time at all.

PRIMITIVE.name: Primitive
PRIMITIVE.description: One of the earliest designs ever made in the history of the Battlemech, it either belongs sitting pretty in a museum, or someone was hard pressed into a corner to use one in combat.

PROTOTYPE.name: Experimental
PROTOTYPE.description: A design in its testing stages, it must've been a pure run of bad luck for it to fall onto someone else's hands, someone that is more than likely interested in paying a lot of money for it.

SHIELDBEARER.name: Shieldbearer
SHIELDBEARER.description: Whilst not using a physical shield, this mech's arms were designed to act as one, helping protect itself from any damage by using them to its advantage.

SHIELDBEARER_LA.name: Shieldbearer
SHIELDBEARER_LA.description: Whilst not using a physical shield, this mech's arm was designed to act as one, helping protect itself from any damage by using it to its advantage.

SHIELDBEARER_RA.name: Shieldbearer
SHIELDBEARER_RA.description: Whilst not using a physical shield, this mech's arm was designed to act as one, helping protect itself from any damage by using it to its advantage.

COMBATCOMPUTER.name: Combat Computer
COMBATCOMPUTER.description: This 'Mech comes equipped with an advanced Combat Computer that helps manage heat levels more efficiently.

COMMAND.name: Command 'Mech
COMMAND.description: This 'Mech was originally designed as a Command Unit.

COMPACT.name: Compact 'Mech
COMPACT.description: This 'Mech is small enough that two of its kind are able to fit in the same storage space as one regular 'Mech.

ARMOREDHEAD.name: Cowl
ARMOREDHEAD.description: This 'Mech has a reinforced cockpit to better protect the pilot.

RELOADBALL.name: Fast Reload (Ballistic)
RELOADBALL.description: This 'Mech uses large, removable ammunition magazines for its Ballistic weapons instead of the regular layout of an ammunition bin.

RELOADMISS.name: Fast Reload (Missile)
RELOADMISS.description: This 'Mech uses large, removable ammunition magazines for its Missile weapons instead of the regular layout of an ammunition bin.

COOLINGAC.name: Improved Cooling Jacket (ACs)
COOLINGAC.description: This 'Mech includes an improved cooling mechanism that reduces the heat generated by AutoCannons.

COOLINGLASER.name: Improved Cooling Jacket (Lasers)
COOLINGLASER.description: This 'Mech includes an improved cooling mechanism that reduces the heat generated by Laser weaponry.

COOLINGPPC.name: Improved Cooling Jacket (PPCs)
COOLINGPPC.description: This 'Mech includes an improved cooling mechanism that reduces the heat generated by PPC weaponry.

REPUTATIONGOOD.name: Good Reputation
REPUTATIONGOOD.description: This 'Mech is extremely popular and is worth more than similarly equipped 'Mechs of the same class.

TWISTARMS.name: Hyper-Extending Actuators
TWISTARMS.description: This 'Mech is capable of raising or lowering its arms further than most other 'Mechs.

STRUCTHEAD.name: Improved Life Support
STRUCTHEAD.description: This 'Mech includes an improved life support system that increases the chances of a pilot surviving a devastating hit.

TARGETINGAA.name: Anti-Air Targeting
TARGETINGAA.description: This 'Mech has a targeting system designed to help fight against aerial units at long range.

TARGETINGIMPROVED.name: Improved Targeting
TARGETINGIMPROVED.description: This 'Mech has a robust targeting system that makes it easier to hit enemy targets.

STRUCTLEGS.name: Protected Actuators
STRUCTLEGS.description: This 'Mech benefits from increased joint protection or more rugged actuators, making it more difficult to lose the legs.

MAINTENANCEEASY.name: Easy to Maintain
MAINTENANCEEASY.description: This 'Mech is built in such a way that repairing and replacing components is a breeze.

SENSORSFOV.name: Multi-Trac
SENSORSFOV.description: This 'Mech is capable of keeping track of multiple targets at the same time.

PILOTEASY.name: Easy to Pilot
PILOTEASY.description: This 'Mech was designed so even the Greenest of pilots have no issues with its controls.

PILOTHARD.name: Hard to Pilot
PILOTHARD.description: This 'Mech was designed in such a way whereas it is inherently more difficult to pilot.

ARMOREDLEGS.name: Reinforced Legs
ARMOREDLEGS.description: This 'Mech has legs that were built for engaging in physical attacks such as kicking or DFAs.

RUGGED.name: Rugged
RUGGED.description: This 'Mech doesn't require much attention to keep it active and ready.

SENSORSIMPROVED.name: Improved Sensors
SENSORSIMPROVED.description: This 'Mech comes equipped with an advanced sensor suite.

EXTRACOMMON.name: Ubiquitous
EXTRACOMMON.description: This 'Mech has been mass-produced for centuries, making it incredibly easy to find replacement parts for.

TWISTEXTENDED.name: Extended Torso Twist
TWISTEXTENDED.description: This 'Mech is capable of twisting its torso further than most 'Mechs.

TWISTURBIE.name: 360° Torso Twist
TWISTURBIE.description: This 'Mech has no limit to how far it can twist its torso, offering a full 360 degree field of fire.

MAINTENANCEHARD.name: Difficult to Maintain
MAINTENANCEHARD.description: This 'Mech has components in hard to reach places, making it difficult to repair and replace its various components.

REPUTATIONPOOR.name: Bad Reputation
REPUTATIONPOOR.description: This 'Mech may be sound and operable, but has done something that has earned it a bad reputation, making it only worth less than similar 'Mechs.

LCT-WEAKLEGS.name: Weak Legs
LCT-WEAKLEGS.description: The Locust is not designed to deal with the stresses associated with physical attacks.

QC_ANNIHILATOR.name: Urban Dominance
QC_ANNIHILATOR.description: Built to be the ultimate urban warfare battlemech, the Annihilator instills fear with just the thought that it may be waiting just around the corner.

QV_ANNIHILATOR_GAUSS.name: Gausszilla
QV_ANNIHILATOR_GAUSS.description: With such a slow speed, it wasn't rare for variants to crop up that utilized a multitude of Gauss Rifles to reach out and touch someone, a type of loadout that earned it a name worthy of its appearance.

QV_ANNIHILATOR_AC.name: Cannoneer
QV_ANNIHILATOR_AC.description: Despite not being seen in centuries since the creation of the 1X, the Annihilators that could be seen in the battlefield often used the tech that was available to them, usually in the form of Autocannons.

QV_ANNIHILATOR_LBX.name: Shotgunner
QV_ANNIHILATOR_LBX.description: The design that marked the Annihilator as something to be feared featured a quartet of LBX10s, able to fire cluster or slugs as the situation unfolded.

QV_ANNIHILATOR_PPC.name: Bolter
QV_ANNIHILATOR_PPC.description: What first started as a field-refit would later become another loadout of the Annihilator that could be feared, swapping the ballistics of the usual variants with a full energy-focused build.

QV_ANNIHILATOR_HERO.name: Hero: Mean Baby
QV_ANNIHILATOR_HERO.description: A Civil War era modification to the 1E variant, the Mean Baby replaces the lasers usually located in the side torsos with a quartet of Short-Range Missiles

QC_BANSHEE.name: CQC Designed
QC_BANSHEE.description: Designed for close-assault operations, the Banshee is both fast and well armored, but fails in comparison to its competition. Despite its shortcomings, it would end up proving effective in defensive melee combat thanks to its large fists, even when they weren't designed for combat.

QV_BANSHEE_HERO_LJ.name: Hero: Lumberjack
QV_BANSHEE_HERO_LJ.description: A customized 3S built by Reinesblatt, the Lumberjack is built purposefully for close combat, replacing the PPCs for a Hatchet and swapping the SRM6 for an LRM10 for when the 'Mech can't reach its opponent.

QV_BANSHEE_HERO_LM.name: Hero: La Malinche
QV_BANSHEE_HERO_LM.description: Adorned with Aztec-inspired art of Old Terra, the La Malinche comes equipped with a vast array of weaponry.

QV_BANSHEE_HERO_SR.name: Hero: Siren
QV_BANSHEE_HERO_SR.description: The personal 'Mech of Solaris Duelist Victor Vandergriff, this customized Banshee 5S comes equipped with jump jets for increased mobility.

QV_BANSHEE_HERO_EXP.name: Prototype: 11X
QV_BANSHEE_HERO_EXP.description: An experimental variant, the 11X was designed to take massive amounts of damage before it could fall. Only three of these chassis were ever produced.

QC_CATAPULT.name: Second-Line Fire-Support
QC_CATAPULT.description: A design that lasted for over a millenia, the Catapult initially failed to impress when its production contract with the Terran Hegemoney failed to be renewed, but it would ultimately stand the test of time as it became the backbone of many armies.

QV_CATAPULT_A.name: A Series
QV_CATAPULT_A.description: The only variant of its kind built without any backup weapons, the freed space allows it to have more ammo and therefore, more time on the field supporting its forces with its LRMs.

QV_CATAPULT_C.name: C Series
QV_CATAPULT_C.description: The C series of Catapult variants focuses primarily on its missile-based indirect-fire support role.

QV_CATAPULT_C6.name: C6 Field Refit
QV_CATAPULT_C6.description: The C6 was based on the C5 variant, removing the Arrow IV artillery to swap it for a set of Plasma Rifles.

QV_CATAPULT_H.name: H Series
QV_CATAPULT_H.description: A Periphery born refit, the H series mix the roles of the C and K series together, providing one arm with missiles and another with energy.

QV_CATAPULT_K.name: K Series
QV_CATAPULT_K.description: Unlike the more common C series, the K series produced by House Kurita focus more on the direct-fire support role.

QV_CATAPULT_K5.name: K Series
QV_CATAPULT_K5.description: Unlike the more common C series, the K series produced by House Kurita focus more on the direct-fire support role.

QV_CATAPULT_K6.name: K6 Field Refit
QV_CATAPULT_K6.description: A Kuritan model based on the K5, the K6 goes back to its roots of indirect-fire support, focusing on keeping its missiles always in range and at the ready.

QV_CATAPULT_HERO_BB.name: Hero: Butterbee
QV_CATAPULT_HERO_BB.description: The personal ride of Jenny Templeton of the Chesterson Reserves, this modification to the C1 variant exchanges the long-range missiles for a quartet of Short-Range Missiles to catch unwary attackers off-guard.

QV_CATAPULT_HERO_J.name: Hero: Jester
QV_CATAPULT_HERO_J.description: Piloted by Leigh Voss, this grinning cat is a departure from the regular K2 variant by being solely composed of energy hardpoints, atop of two AMS that help keep it safe from other opposing Catapults.

QV_CATAPULT_HERO_LN.name: Hero: Lightning
QV_CATAPULT_HERO_LN.description: Piloted by Blixt, the Lightning gains its name from the characteristic thunderous sound of its PPCs, combined with its increased quickness and mobility when compared to other 'Mechs of its kind.

QC_CATAPULT2.name: Second-Generation Fire-Support
QC_CATAPULT2.description: An evolution of the original Catapult designed to be used with newly developed TSEMP cannons while still maintaining its indirect-fire support role.

QC_CENTURION.name: Shieldbearer Mk IX
QC_CENTURION.description: Designed to be paired up with the Trebuchet BattleMech, the Centurion became popular for its ability to withstand and survive any encounter.

QC_CENTURION_OMNI.name: Shieldbearer Omni
QC_CENTURION_OMNI.description: The final form of the venerable Centurion, the use of OmniMech technology allows it to switch its gun arms freely.

QC_CENTURION_TEN.name: Shieldbearer Mk X
QC_CENTURION_TEN.description: An evolution of the original model, the CN10 chassis is 5 tons heavier, allowing it to use a variety of upgrades such as increased armor, all without sacrificing speed thanks to the upgraded engine.

QV_CENTURION_BALLISTIC.name: Gun Arm: Ballistic
QV_CENTURION_BALLISTIC.description: The more common and popular of the variants usually come with a high-caliber ballistic weapon equipped on its right arm, such as an AC/10 or even the feared AC/20.

QV_CENTURION_ENERGY.name: Gun Arm: Energy
QV_CENTURION_ENERGY.description: Although less feared than its ballistic counterparts, Centurions with an energy-focused gun arm can become just as fearsome from a further distance as they are less ammo dependent.

QV_CENTURION_HERO_YLW.name: Hero: Yen-Lo-Wang
QV_CENTURION_HERO_YLW.description: More than just a Centurion variant that became the face of the Solaris Arenas, the Yen-Lo-Wang spanned hundreds of years and generations as it was passed on, and always remained effective on where it was born.

QC_FIRESTARTER.name: Incendiary Standard
QC_FIRESTARTER.description: The Firestarter was first designed entirely around its Flamers, and its success would later make it the standard for which all incendiary mechs strived to achieve.

QV_FIRESTARTER_MIRAGE.name: Mirage
QV_FIRESTARTER_MIRAGE.description: The -M variants of the Firestarter, often nicknamed Mirage, traded the well known flamers for the more common laser array, setting it up as a front-line unit.

QV_FIRESTARTER_SCOUT.name: Scout
QV_FIRESTARTER_SCOUT.description: The -S variants of the Firestarter were refit for use as scouts, often installing Active Probes, ECMs or AMS for survival.

QV_FIRESTARTER_STD.name: Standard
QV_FIRESTARTER_STD.description: The regular standard build of the Firestarter focuses on a mix of lasers and machine-guns for close-range combat.

QV_FIRESTARTER_HERO_EXP.name: Prototype: 81X
QV_FIRESTARTER_HERO_EXP.description: One of the three prototypes developed by Defiance Industries, the FS9-81X used the FS9-H as a base to further improve its incendiary loadout - equipping a Plasma Rifle and an XXL Engine while keeping the original array of flamers.

QV_FIRESTARTER_HERO_EMBER.name: Hero: Ember
QV_FIRESTARTER_HERO_EMBER.description: Appropriately named for its loadout, the Ember lets loose with its mix of flamers and machine guns, ignoring lasers entirely.

QV_FIRESTARTER_HERO_FS.name: Hero: Firestorm
QV_FIRESTARTER_HERO_FS.description: Used by a member of Phillip Capet's Capellan Mafia during their final duel against Justin Allard in Solaris VII, the Firestorm focuses entirely on its arm-mounted ballistic weaponry.

QC_MARAUDER.name: Command 'Mech
QC_MARAUDER.description: One of the most well known 'Mechs in existence, the Marauder was built for use as an attack and direct-fire support 'Mech, but its popularity and impressive firepower ensured its place as the 'Mech of choice for leaders of a Lance.

QV_MARAUDER_DAVION.name: FedSuns Refit
QV_MARAUDER_DAVION.description: Although the Federated Suns tend to be well known for their love of Autocannons, the Davion commissioned refits usually replaced the Autocannon for a Large Laser, creating a less ammo dependent build.

QV_MARAUDER_LIAO.name: Capellan Refit
QV_MARAUDER_LIAO.description: The Capellan Confederation variants of the Marauder replaced the heat intensive PPCs for less intensive Large Lasers, ensuring the design was less prone to overheating.

QV_MARAUDER_MARIK.name: Free Worlds Refit
QV_MARAUDER_MARIK.description: While somewhat similar to the Capellan style of refit thanks to the overabundance of Large Lasers in stock, the later variations from the Free Worlds would focus more on the mobility of the 'Mech.

QV_MARAUDER_STEINER.name: Lyran Refit
QV_MARAUDER_STEINER.description: A style of loadout that arrived much later after the events of the Jihad, the Lyran fits usually stuck to the mantra of the standard fits, but often replacing the Autocannon for a Gauss Rifle.

QV_MARAUDER_STD.name: Standard Fit
QV_MARAUDER_STD.description: The Standard fit of the 'Mech focused on keeping the distance, using its PPCs and Autocannon to keep enemies at bay.

QV_MARAUDER_HERO_EXP.name: Prototype: 4X
QV_MARAUDER_HERO_EXP.description: Designed by Ronin Incorporated during the War of 3039, the 4X Marauder was a last attempt at effectively using the heat intensive Binary Lasers, utilizing the latest in prototype technology to make the heat as bearable as possible.

QV_MARAUDER_HERO_BH.name: Hero: Bounty Hunter
QV_MARAUDER_HERO_BH.description: The most well known and most spoken of MechWarrior in history, all people know about the person that is only known as the Bounty Hunter is their 'Mech of choice, often a Marauder laden with LosTech weaponry and equipment

QC_STALKER.name: Combat Computer
QC_STALKER.description: The Stalker is well known for making use of an advanced Combat Computer that helps manage heat levels more efficiently.

QV_STALKER_ENERGY.name: Energy Focused
QV_STALKER_ENERGY.description: These variants of Stalkers were known for focusing more on direct-fire support power through its energy weapons.

QV_STALKER_MISSILE.name: Missile Focused
QV_STALKER_MISSILE.description: These variants of Stalkers were known for focusing more on indirect-fire support power through its missilery.

QV_STALKER_HERO_JAGAWEN.name: Hero: Sword of Light
QV_STALKER_HERO_JAGAWEN.description: The personal 'Mech of Jagawen Torisobo, the commander of the DCMS Eighth Sword of Light that fought in the Battle of Misery against the Wolf's Dragoons, it exchanges the usual LRMs of the Stalker for an additional set of SRM6s on each side torso, making it a fearsome close-range brawler.

QV_STALKER_HERO_MISERY.name: Hero: Misery
QV_STALKER_HERO_MISERY.description: The personal 'Mech of J. Elliot Jamison, the commander of the Wolf's Dragoons Zeta Battalion. In the Battle of Misery against the DMCS, Jamison's Stalker offered a wild change from the standard Stalker by fielding a LosTech Gauss Rifle in the left torso, but later after the Clan Invasion, Jamison's Misery would go back to its roots under the form of a Clan-tech enhanced Stalker.
